Dear Marion:
I *m back raring up my head with another
NAEB PR suggestion.
Two jears ago you may recall that I
suggested that NAEB join with NET in the develop¬
ment of a static New York World!s Fair exposition
display* At that time, Mr. Harold Hill said that
NAEB had previously thought of this idea, and
had investigated it, only to find it too expen¬
sive a venture.
I'm back suggesting it be thought of again.
If you attended the Fair this summer, you
will agree that the Hall of Education contained
very little dealing with education. It is my
understanding that the Fair Authority had many
of those who originally planned to exhibit in
it fall through. As a result, it is basically a
vendor-house which includes a cafeteria and a
kosher delicatessen. I believe an investigation
would find the Fair Authority permitting TV
educators exhibit in this Hall for little or
no rental. I believe, also, the Fair will have
as large an audience as it had this year.
Am always eager to see ETV promoted.
Lou Peneguy, Director
